document_title: Decompensated heart failure: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Decompensated heart failure is a condition that occurs acutely (newly discovered without a previous diagnosis) or results from an exacerbation (a period of worsening symptoms) of pre-existing heart failure. . (first)
Heart failure is a condition in which the heart cannot pump enough blood to meet all of the body's needs. When heart failure becomes severe enough to cause symptoms that require immediate treatment, it is called decompensated heart failure.
subsection_title: suy tim mat bu.json. What is decompensated heart failure?

Heart failure is a condition in which the heart cannot pump enough blood to meet all of the body's needs. When heart failure becomes severe enough to cause symptoms that require immediate treatment, it is called decompensated heart failure.
